file_content.text: Prosk, do you read? Another camp down and still no Lemda. Any luck on your end?
Hang on--getting a distress call... It's her! Patching through...
We read you, Lemda. Your uncle sent a rescue team. The Republic's here--look!
Shalim didn't send... more?
We're enough. Give us your coordinates, and we'll get you to safety.
Tell us where you are.
He told us you're a respected geophysicist. You look like a student. How old are you?
You're a kid, not a scientist!
I received my doctorate eight years ago. I was sixteen. Intimidated yet?
The mercenaries thought the same thing, and they got a nasty surprise.
Don't underestimate us.
If you say so.
My guards abandoned their posts and left me alone. You must be the "murdering scum" they went after.
I broke free and ran to the nearest quake shelter. I'm the only person here. Sending you coordinates....
It's always nice when prisoners help with their own rescues.
Well done.
Didn't have anything to lose by trying.
If you'd tried anything but getting to safety, you might have been captured again--or worse.
You did the smart thing.
Figured this was the safest place.
Get out of there. If the Regulators surround that shelter, you'll be trapped inside.
Enclosed spaces aren't safe.
I see your point.
I love a good prison breakout story. Did you use the old "fork in the door circuits" trick?
How did you escape?
Can we do this later?
Don't move--the mesa is crawling with Regulators. Stay put and let us come get you.
I'm on my way.
I'm not setting foot out there.
For all we know, the Regulators let you go. Maybe we're walking right into an ambush....
This feels like a trap.
Do I have to save myself?
Wait, what was that noise? Is that on your end?
Lost her! They're blocking her signal. My team's close to that quake shelter. Meet you there!
Prosk, come in. We've taken out multiple Regulator camps. Still no sign of Lemda.
Scouts report you've got those mercenaries chasing their own tails.
Lemda has to be nearby. I'll take some men out and cover more ground.
Think you're clever? Killing my people, slicing our comm channel?
Every time you hit us, the Hutts crack down even harder on the nice people of Makeb. They're dying because of you.
Stop making things worse.
You can end this any time. You know my terms for your surrender.
I'm not the one who's about to die.
Misdirected rage won't save you. Peace is your only option.
Typical smug Jedi. Well, I tried.
If that's true, you're guilty of war crimes. Surrender, and maybe you'll avoid a firing squad.
That's generous, Major--but I'll pass.
If there's any justice, I'll get to drop you naked into an angry mob of those "nice people" you're killing.
There's no justice, Captain. You of all people know that.
You're supposed to protect Makeb, but you sold out to the Hutts. How much are they paying you to execute innocent people?
The responsibility is yours.
Enough, obviously.
Those deaths are on your head, not mine.
Not my problem.
Make your peace while you can.
You should've taken the hint. I command the Regulators, and I've got plenty of reinforcements to throw your way. Now they're angry.
We don't have to fight.
This won't end well for you. Surrender and turn over the scientist.
Regulators don't take orders from Jedi.
All I want is Lemda. I have no desire to inflict casualties.
My Regulators don't share that sentiment, Master Jedi.
You'll never have enough men. Let the scientist go--now.
And deny my Regulators a shot at revenge? No.
I know you have a hearing problem, but seriously... give up the scientist.
Hear this, you low-rent spacer: You're dead. My Regulators will hunt you down.
Whatever the Hutts are paying, it's not enough. Quit while you're behind.
This is a losing deal for you.
This op will be profitable long after you're gone.
The longer you waste my time, the worse it'll be when I find you.
Don't make me angry.
Good luck with that. My Regulators get double pay to bring me your head.
It's Prosk. You read? We sliced the mercs' comm network. Hearing all kinds of interesting chatter.
Whatever you're doing, it's paying off. The mercs have pulled back--the landing zone's all ours.
Dig in and be ready, in case they come back.
Hold your position.
Take the battle to them. Chase that scum off the nearest cliff.
Pursue and destroy.
Understood. We'll keep listening to the mercs bellyache, too. Might learn something we can use. Keep up the pressure!
Red Team, come in. This is Vice Commandant Grevin. We scanned heavy fire in your zone. Status report.
Let Lemda go free.
You kidnapped a harmless scientist. If you want to avoid another fight, let her go.
We didn't kidnap anyone, Jedi. We arrested a subversive.
Your men chose fighting over negotiating. Be reasonable and free the geophysicist.
You have no authority here, Jedi. That girl is our legal prisoner.
The battle's over. Your team lost. Hand over the scientist you captured.
Save it, soldier. I have a legal arrest warrant for Lemda Avesta, signed by the Hutt Cartel leaders.
Everything's jolly. Give up the lady scientist, and it'll stay that way.
The girl's charged with treason against Makeb's rightful government. You just proved her guilty.
That's a real fancy title, Grevin. Did you make it up yourself?
Who are you, scum?
I command Regulator forces on this whole hemisphere. You've got two choices: surrender now, or die.
Start running now. You might get out alive.
You're going to die.
You're outnumbered by troops who have run ops in thirty systems. Our victory rate is one hundred percent.
You got lucky this time. It won't happen again.
Blast! Is this stupid thing working? Hello? Hello!
